page.title: 08Ammenities in Calverton
page.content: There is a public telephone. The village is served by a water mains, overhead electricity mains and a mains sewer. There is a church ,a public house serving food,and the village is also served by a mobile library. A minor road disects the area running North West to South East.There was a bus service for a few years.This was discontinued in the 1970s. Alongside the road through Lower Weald is a flood drainage ditch.During very heavy rainstorms this is inadequate. Occasionally some houses are affected.
